intro: Hieracium haploicum, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are often heart-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from June to August. Hieracium haploicum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
